content: FYI - HL7 has created fixed amalgamated ballot spreadsheets for the 11 FHIR ballots so that they can be loaded into gForge. We are sending out these amalgamated spreadsheets to the project co-chairs so that project teams can do an initial triaging of comments. The triaging needs to happen by Friday night so that the final comments can be loaded into gForge on Saturday morning.
(deleted)
what exactly is triaging of comments entail?
filling in the initial columns in light blue - Comment grouping, Schedule, Triage note, initial dispositions, etc.
The Comment group field in the spreadsheet isn't a pick list. Should its contents match up to the items in gForge under "Group:"?
Yes, that would be the best thing to do.

And to be clear - this means we have to work in both the spreadsheet and gForge right, since the comments that are only references to trackers don't have any other detail in the spreadsheet? I ask because it seems like it would be easier to do the grouping/schedule/triage note when everything is in one place?
If you would prefer to triage in gforge, we can see if @Josh Mandel can load your comments sooner.
I would prefer to triage them all in the same place, and it seems that would likely need to be gForge. So yes, if @Josh Mandel doesn't mind, that would be great.
Is this one of the 10 test files at https://github.com/jmandel/csv-to-fhir-tracker/tree/201805/2018-05-preload ?
Yes - the CG one
OK. This is going to be... kinda dicey with hotel wifi. Let's have a go.
Will the upload process set the "Ballot" field in gForge I assume?
yes
So if we had someone log trackers, but they did not submit a ballot comment spreadsheet, I would assume those trackers will not officially be associated with the Ballot ?
that is correct.
We tried to be quite clear that submission using the ballot desktop was still required.
You were, but I just wanted to verify.
Were the spreadsheets sent out? I haven't seen them come through
Check your spam folder
gmail didn't like the email for some reason
To verify, this doesn't include the FHIRPath comments, correct? I've got an amalgamated spreadsheet for that already and am working on getting it import ready.
It should have, but I didn't notice it, so probably best you're doing it yourself.
